titleStmt.title: To FREDERIC CHAPMAN,Frederic (or Frederick) Chapman (1823-95), publisher. He became a partner of Chapman and Hall in 1847, and took over the firm when his cousin Edward Chapman (1804-80) retired in 1864. From 1865 he also published the Fortnightly Review. 2 FEBRUARY 1866

body.p: I am very sorry to hear that your wifeClara Chapman, née Woodin, whom Chapman married on 21 November 1861 is so ill, and also that you have but newly passed through other domestic misfortunes. I hope that your removal of your invalidChapman had taken her to Bournemouth, where she died on 28 February 1866. may lead to better results, and of course could not expect to see you at such a time.
